Package game

Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Board
  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents the board of the game. It manages some rules as the promotion of pawns to lighten the code of the server.

    • Method Detail

      • getBoard

        public Piece[][] getBoard()

      • update

        public java.lang.String update​(java.util.List<Player> players,
                               Strike strike)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               java.lang.ClassNotFoundException,
                               Break75StrikeRuleException,
                               FiveInHistoryException
        This function update the board by playing the strike. It also update the attribute of the pieces (in_passing, can_castle, has_moved). A promotion step is done if necessary (a pawn reached the other side of the board). It finally checks that no draw rules are broken (75 moves, 5 hold).
        Parameters:
        players - The players
        strike - The to play by one of the player
        Returns:
        The message to send to the players
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if a player is unreachable
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - if a player is unreachable
        Break75StrikeRuleException - if there is a breach of the 75 strike rule
        FiveInHistoryException - if there is a breach of 5 hold rule

      • result

        public java.lang.String result​(Player player)
        Return the result (checkmate/stalemate) of the game when a player cannot move anymore.
        Parameters:
        player - The player which cannot move anymore
        Returns:
        A string representing the result

      • fetchPieces

        public java.util.List<java.util.List<java.lang.Integer>> fetchPieces​(int color)
        Fetching the cells on the board of the pieces for a given color.
        Parameters:
        color - The color to consider
        Returns:
        A list of the cells

      • getClone

        public Board getClone()
        Gets a clone of the board. Useful to simulates a strike not on the actual board. For example to check if then the player is not in check. Do not copy the counter and the history as not useful for the purpose.
        Returns:
        The cloned board

      • simulation

        public Piece simulation​(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> start_cell,
                        java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> end_cell)
        Simulates a strike on the calling board. Is used to play a move or to see if a piece can do the move. It also updates the attributes of the moved piece if it is a pawn, rook or king.
        Parameters:
        start_cell - Starting cell of the strike.
        end_cell - Ending cell of the strike.
        Returns:
        The eaten piece, or null if no piece has been eaten.

      • getState

        public char[][] getState()
        Gets the state of the board to send to the client and be drawn be the GUI.
        Returns:
        The state of the board.
